intro: Aconitum reflexum, commonly known as the reflexed monkshood, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features striking, hood-shaped blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has dark green, doubly serrated leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It prefers moist, well-drained soils in shaded to partially shaded environments. Aconitum reflexum is part of the Ranunculaceae family and contains toxic alkaloids, making it potentially dangerous if ingested.
